info.title: Account Management API
info.description: API for managing 3scale Admin Portal objects, such as Accounts, Applications, Users, API products, gateway configurations etc.

post.description: This request allows you to reproduce a developer sign-up in a single API call. It will create an Account, an Admin User for the account, and optionally an Application with its keys. If the plan_id is not passed, the default plan will be used instead. You can add additional custom parameters in Fields Definition on your Admin Portal.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See SignupExpressRequest schema for the request body definition.

get.description: Returns the list of buyer accounts (the accounts that consume your API). Filters by state are available and the results can be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

get.description: Returns a buyer account.

put.description: Updates a buyer account by ID. You can modify all the fields on the account, including custom fields defined in the fields definition section of your admin portal. Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value).

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See AccountUpdateRequest schema for the request body definition.

delete.description: Deletes a buyer account. Deleting an account removes all users, applications and service subscriptions to the account.

get.description: Find an account by the username or email of its users (username takes precedence over email).

parameters.name: buyer_provider_key
parameters.description: [Master API] Provider key of the account.

parameters.name: buyer_service_token
parameters.description: [Master API] Service token of the account service.

get.description: List all the service subscriptions of an account.

post.description: Subscribe an account to a service through the specified service plan.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific service subscription.

delete.description: Unsubscribe from a service. This endpoint will delete all the applications under the subscribed service.

put.description: Approve a pending service subscription.
Update the plan of a service subscription.

plan_id.description: ID of the target account plan

get.description: Returns the list of application of an account.

post.description: Create an application. The application object can be extended with Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal where you can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See ApplicationCreateRequest schema for the request body definition.

get.description: Returns the application by id.

put.description: Updates an application. All fields of the application object can be updated except the id and the app_id (when using OAuth or app_id/app_key authentication pattern).

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See ApplicationUpdateRequest schema for the request body definition.

delete.description: Deletes the application.

put.description: Accepts an application (changes the state to live). Once the state is live the application can be used on API requests.
Changes the application plan of an application.

plan_id.description: ID of the new application plan.

put.description: Creates a customized application plan for the application.
Decustomizes the plan of an application.
Resume a suspended application. Once a suspended application is resumed it will be authorized on API requests.
Suspends an application (changes the state to suspended). Suspending an application will stop the application from authorizing API requests.

get.description: Lists the Application Keys (or the Client Secret for OAuth or OpenID Connect modes) of the application.

post.description: Adds an application key for App Id/App Key mode (until a maximum of 5 keys) or the Client Secret for OAuth or OpenID Connect modes (only one).

key.description:
app_key to be added.

Allowed characters: A-Z a-z 0-9 ! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / : ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ ` { | } ~ , no spaces and between 5 and 255 characters.

delete.description: Deletes an application key for App Id/App Key mode or the Client Secret for OAuth or OpenID Connect modes. An application may have to have at least one App Key (controlled by settings).

get.description: Lists referrer filters of the application.

post.description: Adds a referrer filter to an application. Referrer filters limit API requests by domain or IP ranges.

delete.description: Deletes a referrer filter of an application. Referrer filters limit API requests by domain or IP ranges.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of referrer filter to be deleted.

post.description: Sends a message to the account.

get.description: Returns the account plan associated to an account.
This endpoint is deprecated, use `GET /admin/api/accounts/{account_id}/service_subscriptions.xml` instead.

delete.description: This endpoint is deprecated, use `DELETE /admin/api/accounts/{account_id}/service_subscriptions/{id}.xml` instead.

put.description: Approves the account (changes the state to live). Accounts need to be approved explicitly via this API after creation. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml
Changes the account plan for the buyer account.

plan_id.description: ID of the target account plan

put.description: Associates credit card tokens and billing address to an account. This operation is only required if you use your own credit card capture method. These tokens are the ones required by Authorize.net, braintree, payment express and merchant e solutions

credit_card_token.description: Token used by the payment gateway to identify the buyer, customer profile ID (Authorize.net), customer ID (Braintree and Stripe). Some payment gateways may store more than one card under the same buyer reference and/or require an additional identifier for recurring payment. If you are using Braintree, there is no need for additional identifier -- the first credit card available will always be charged. For Authorize.net, see `credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profile_token`.

credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profil.description: Additional reference provided by the payment gateway to identify a specific card under the same buyer reference. For Authorize.net, you MUST fill with the 'Payment profile token'

credit_card_expiration_year.description: Year of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

credit_card_expiration_month.description: Month of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

billing_address_name.description: Name of the person/company to bill

billing_address_address.description: Address associated to the credit card

credit_card_partial_number.description: Last four digits on the credit card

delete.description: Removes all credit card info of an account.

put.description: Resets the state of the account to pending so that it can be approved or rejected again.

Rejects the account (changes the state to rejected). An account can be rejected after creation, the workflow for account creation can have a validation process that ends in approving or rejecting the account submission. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

get.description: Returns the list of users of an account. The list can be filtered by the state or role of the users.

post.description: Creates a new user of the account (account_id). Do not forget to activate the user otherwise he/she will be unable to sign-in. After creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended using Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See UserCreateRequest schema for the request body definition.

get.description: Returns the user of an account.

put.description: Updates the user of an account. You can update any field, not only those in the form of the ActiveDocs but all the fields that belong to the User object. Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). Remember that you can define custom fields on your Admin Portal.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See UserUpdateRequest schema for the request body definition.

delete.description: Deletes a user of an account. The last user can't be deleted

put.description: Activate the user of an account. A user is created in the pending state and needs to be activated before he/she is able to sign-in.

additional_fields[].description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

put.description: Changes the role of the user to admin.
Changes the role of the user to member.
Changes the state of the user to suspended. A suspended user cannot sign-in.
Change the state of the user back to active.

get.description: Lists the users of the provider account. You can apply filters by state and/or role.

post.description: Creates a new user in the provider account. Do not forget to activate it, otherwise he/she will not be able to sign-in. After creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended using Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal where you can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc. Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). Additional fields are the custom fields declared in the Fields Definitions section in your API Admin Portal.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See UserCreateRequest schema for the request body definition.

get.description: Gets the user of the provider account by ID.

put.description: Modifies the user of the provider account by ID. You can update any field, not only those in the form of the ActiveDocs but also fields that belong to the User object. Remember that you can define custom fields on your Admin Portal.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See UserUpdateRequest schema for the request body definition.

delete.description: Deletes the user of the provider account by ID.

put.description: Changes the state of the user of the provider account to active (after sign-up). You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.

put.summary: User Change Role to Admin (provider account)
put.description: Changes the role of the provider account to admin (full rights and privileges).

put.summary: User Change Role to Member (provider account)
put.description: Changes the role of the user of the provider account to member.

get.description: Shows the permissions of the user of the provider account.

put.description: Updates the permissions of member user of the provider account.

allowed_service_ids[].description: IDs of the services that need to be enabled, URL-encoded array. To disable all services, send `allowed_service_ids[]` with an empty value, e.g. `allowed_service_ids%5B%5D=` (can't be done in ActiveDocs). `<allowed_service_ids/>` or `"allowed_service_ids":[]` in the response indicate that no services are allowed. To enable all services, send 'allowed_service_ids' with no value to the 'curl' command, e.g. `allowed_service_ids=` (can't be done in ActiveDocs). Missing `<allowed_service_ids>` or `"allowed_service_ids":null` indicate that all services are allowed.

allowed_sections[].description: The list of sections in the admin portal that the user can access, URL-encoded array. Possible values: 'portal' (Developer Portal), 'finance' (Billing), 'settings', 'partners' (Accounts -- Applications), 'monitoring' (Analytics), 'plans' (Integration & Application Plans), 'policy_registry'. To disable all sections, set the value to '[]'.

put.description: Changes the state of the user of the provider account to suspended, which removes the user's ability to sign-in. You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.
Revokes the suspension of a user of the provider account. You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.

post.description: [Deprecated API] Use "Personal Access Tokens Create". Creates an access token. Make sure to copy your new personal access token now. You will not be able to see it again as it is not stored for security reasons.

permission.description: Permission of the access token. It must be either 'ro' (read only) or 'rw' (read and write).

scopes[].description: Scope of the access token. URL-encoded array containing one or more of the possible values. The possible values are, for a master user ["account_management", "stats"], and for a tenant user ["finance", "account_management", "stats", "cms", "policy_registry"]

expires_at.description: Expiration time of the access token. In ISO 8601 format

get.description: Returns the list of all available account plans.

post.description: Creates an account plan.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Accounts require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

state_event.description: State event of the account plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

get.description: Returns the list of the features enabled for an account plan.

post.description: Enables an account feature on an account plan.

delete.description: Disables an account feature on an account plan.

get.description: Returns the account plan by ID.

put.description: Updates an account plan.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Accounts require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

state_event.description: State event of the account plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

delete.description: Deletes an account plan.

put.description: Set the account plan to be the default one. The default account plan is used unless another account plan is passed explicitly, for instance on the signup express.

get.description: Lists all ActiveDocs specs

post.description: Creates a new ActiveDocs spec

system_name.description: System Name of the ActiveDocs spec. Only ASCII letters, numbers, dashes and underscores are allowed. If blank, 'system_name' will be generated from the 'name' parameter

service_id.description: Service ID of the ActiveDocs spec

body.description: ActiveDocs specification in JSON format (based on Swagger)

published.description: Set to 'true' to publish the spec on the developer portal, or 'false' to hide it. The default value is 'false'

skip_swagger_validations.description: Set to 'true' to skip validation of the Swagger specification, or 'false' to validate the spec. The default value is 'false'

get.description: Returns the ActiveDocs spec by ID

put.description: Updates the ActiveDocs spec by ID

service_id.description: Service ID of the ActiveDocs spec

body.description: ActiveDocs specification in JSON format (based on Swagger)

published.description: Set to 'true' to publish the spec on the developer portal, or 'false' to hide it. The default value is 'false'

skip_swagger_validations.description: Set to 'true' to skip validation of the Swagger specification, or 'false' to validate the spec. The default value is 'false'

delete.description: Deletes the ActiveDocs spec by ID

get.description: Returns the list of all application plans across services. Note that application plans are scoped by service.
Returns the list of features enabled on the application plan.

post.description: Enables a feature on an application plan.

delete.description: Disable a feature on an application plan.

get.description: Returns the list of all limits associated to an application plan.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 50.

get.description: Returns the list of all limits associated to a metric of an application plan.

post.description: Adds a limit to a metric of an application plan. All applications with the application plan (application_plan_id) will be constrained by this new limit on the metric (metric_id).

get.description: Returns a limit on a metric of an application plan.

put.description: Updates a limit on a metric of an application plan.

delete.description: Deletes a limit on a metric of an application plan.

get.description: Returns the list of all pricing rules associated to a metric of an application plan.

post.description: Creates a pricing rule for an associated application plan.

delete.description: Deletes a pricing rule for a given application plan and metric.

get.summary: Pricing Rules List per Application Plan
get.description: Returns the list of all pricing rules associated to an application plan.
Returns the list of all application plans of a service.

post.description: Creates an application plan.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Applications require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

state_event.description: State event of the application plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

get.description: Returns and application plan.

put.description: Updates an application plan.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Applications require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

state_event.description: State event of the application plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

delete.description: Deletes an application plan.

put.description: Makes the application plan the default one. New applications will be assigned to the default plan unless an application_plan_id is explicity passed (e.g. on the signup express operation).

get.description: Returns the list of applications across all services. Note that applications are scoped by service and can be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

get.description: Finds an application by keys used on the integration of your API and 3scale's Service Management API or by application ID.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: user_key of the application (for user_key authentication mode).

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: app_id of the application (for app_id/app_key and oauth authentication modes).

get.description: Returns the list of all the authentication providers for the admin portal.

post.description: Creates an authentication provider for the admin portal.

kind.description: The kind of authentication provider which can be either 'auth0' or 'keycloak'. Use 'keycloak' for Red Hat Single Sign-On.

system_name.description: System Name of the authentication provider.

client_id.description: Client ID of the authentication provider.

client_secret.description: Client Secret of the authentication provider.

site.description: Site o Realm of the authentication provider.

skip_ssl_certificate_verification.description: Skip SSL certificate verification. False by default.

published.description: Published authentication provider. False by default

get.description: Read an authentication provider for the admin portal.

put.description: Updates an authentication provider for the admin portal.

client_id.description: Client ID of the authentication provider.

client_secret.description: Client Secret of the authentication provider.

site.description: Site o Realm of the authentication provider.

skip_ssl_certificate_verification.description: Skip SSL certificate verification. False by default.

published.description: Published authentication provider. False by default

get.description: Returns the list of all the authentication providers for the developer portal.

post.description: Creates an authentication provider for the developer portal.

kind.description: The kind of authentication provider which can be either 'github', 'auth0', 'keycloak' or a custom one. Use 'keycloak' for Red Hat Single Sign-On.

system_name.description: System Name of the authentication provider.

client_id.description: Client ID of the authentication provider.

client_secret.description: Client Secret of the authentication provider.

site.description: Site o Realm of the authentication provider.

token_url.description: Token URL of the authentication provider.

user_info_url.description: User info URL of the authentication provider.

authorize_url.description: Authorize URL of the authentication provider.

trust_email.description: Trust emails automatically. False by default

published.description: Published authentication provider. False by default

branding_state_event.description: Branding state event of the authentication provider. Only available for Github. It can be either 'brand_as_threescale' (the default one) or 'custom_brand'

skip_ssl_certificate_verification.description: Skip SSL certificate verification. False by default.

automatically_approve_accounts.description: Automatically approve accounts. False by default.

get.description: Returns an authentication provider.

put.description: Updates an authentication provider for the developer portal.

client_id.description: Client ID of the authentication provider.

client_secret.description: Client Secret of the authentication provider.

site.description: Site o Realm of the authentication provider.

published.description: Published authentication provider. False by default

skip_ssl_certificate_verification.description: Skip SSL certificate verification. False by default.

automatically_approve_accounts.description: Automatically approve accounts. False by default.

get.description: Returns the list of backend APIs. The results can be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

post.description: Creates a Backend.

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

get.description: Returns a backend.

put.description: Updates a backend.

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

delete.description: Deletes a backend.

get.description: Returns the Mapping Rules of a Backend.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

post.description: Creates a Mapping Rule of a Backend.

delta.description: Increase the metric by this delta.

last.description: Last matched Mapping Rule to process

get.description: Returns the Mapping Rule of a Backend.

put.description: Updates a Mapping Rule of a Backend.

delta.description: Increase the metric by this delta.

last.description: Last matched Mapping Rule to process

delete.description: Deletes a Mapping Rule of a Backend.

get.description: Returns the list of metrics of a backend API.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

post.description: Creates a metric on a backend API.

system_name.description: System Name of the metric. If blank a system_name will be generated for you from the friendly_name parameter.

get.description: Returns the metric of a backend API.

put.description: Updates the metric of a backend API.

delete.description: Deletes the metric of a backend API. When you delete a metric or a method, it will also remove all the associated limits.

get.description: List the methods of a metric that belongs to a backend API. Methods are metrics that are children of a parent metric.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

post.description: Creates a method under a metric that belongs to a backend API.

system_name.description: System Name of the method. If blank a system_name will be generated for you from the friendly_name parameter.

get.description: Returns the method of a metric that belongs to a backend API.

put.description: Updates a method of a metric that belongs to a backend API.

delete.description: Deletes the method of a metric that belongs to a backend API.

get.description: Returns the list of all Backend being used by a Service (Product) with the corresponding path.

post.description: Adds a Backend to a Service (Product).

backend_api_id.description: Backend to be added to the Service (Product).

path.description: Path of the Backend for this product.

get.description: Show the usage of a Backend within the scope of the Service (Product).

put.description: Updates the path of a Backend within the scope of the Service (Product).

path.description: Path of the Backend for this product.

delete.description: Removes the backend from a Service (Product).

get.description: Returns the list of the features available to accounts. Account features are globally scoped.

post.description: Create an account feature. The features of the account are globally scoped. Creating a feature does not associate the feature with an account plan.

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

get.description: Returns an account feature.

put.description: Updates an account feature.

delete.description: Deletes an account feature.

get.description: Returns the list of all fields definitions.

post.description: Creates a new fields definition.

target.description: Target entity of fields definition (use Cinstance for Application).

name.description: Name of the fields definition to be created.

label.description: The field title your developers will see.

required.description: If 'true' the field will be required for developers.

hidden.description: If 'true' the developers won't be able to see this field.

read_only.description: If 'true' the developers won't be able to change this field.

get.description: Returns the fields definition by id.

put.description: Updates the fields definition.

target.description: Target entity of fields definition (use Cinstance for Application).

label.description: The field title your developers will see.

read_only.description: If 'true' the developers won't be able to change this field.

required.description: If 'true' the field will be required for developers.

hidden.description: If 'true' the developers won't be able to see this field.

delete.description: Deletes the fields definition.

get.summary: Object deletion status for objects that are deleted asynchronously
get.description: Returns an object status. (200/404). Useful for those objects that deleted asynchronously in order to know if the deletion has been completed(404) or not(200)

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Object type has to be service, account, proxy or backend_api.

get.description: Returns the list of access tokens of the user. If the parameter name is sent, it returns only those whose name contain the string of the param

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Part of the name of the access token.

post.description: Creates an access token. Make sure to copy your new personal access token now. You will not be able to see it again as it is not stored for security reasons.

permission.description: Permission of the access token. It must be either 'ro' (read only) or 'rw' (read and write).

scopes[].description: Scope of the access token. URL-encoded array containing one or more of the possible values. The possible values are, for a master user ["account_management", "stats", "policy_registry"], and for a tenant user ["finance", "account_management", "stats", "policy_registry", "cms"]

expires_at.description: Expiration time of the access token. In ISO 8601 format

get.description: Shows an access token.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or value of the access token.

delete.description: Deletes an access token.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or value of the access token.

get.description: Returns the list of notification preferences for the current user.

patch.description: Update the notification preferences for the current user.

account_created.description: New account created. Sent when a developer account is created.

account_deleted.description: Account deleted. Sent when an account is deleted.

account_plan_change_requested.description: Account plan change request. Sent when a developer requests to change to a different account plan.

application_created.description: New application created. Sent when a new application is created.

application_plan_change_requested.description: Application plan change request. Sent when a request for application plan change is made.

cinstance_cancellation.description: Application deleted. Sent when an application is deleted.

cinstance_expired_trial.description: Application trial expired. Sent when an application trial period expires.

cinstance_plan_changed.description: Application plan change. Sent when an application is changed to a different plan.

credit_card_unstore_failed.description: Unstoring credit card failed. Sent when customers credit card failed to be unstored from your payment gateway.

csv_data_export.description: CSV data export. Sent when a member of your team generates a report with data about messages/ developer accounts/ applications.

daily_report.description: Daily report. Contains information about your API(s) performance in the last 24 hours.

expired_credit_card_provider.description: Expiring credit card. Sent when a customers credit card is about to expire.

invoices_to_review.description: Action required: review invoices. Sent a few days before end of billing cycle so you can review invoices before they are being sent to customers.

limit_alert_reached_provider.description: 'Alert: usage warning. Sent when an application triggers a usage alert for usage levels below 100%.

limit_violation_reached_provider.description: Alert: usage violation. Sent when an application triggers a usage alert for usage levels of 100% and above.

message_received.description: New messages. Sent when a developer sends you a new message.

plan_downgraded.description: Customer downgraded. Sent when a customer changes to a plan with a lower monthly fixed price.

service_contract_cancellation.description: Service subscription cancelled. Sent when an existing service subscription is cancelled.

service_contract_created.description: New service subscription. Sent when a new service subscription is started.

service_contract_plan_changed.description: Service subscription changed. Sent when an existing service subscription is changed.

service_deleted.description: Service deleted. Sent when a service is deleted.

service_plan_change_requested.description: Service plan change request. Sent when a developer requests to change to a different service plan.

unsuccessfully_charged_invoice_final_pro.description: Payment error (final). Sent when the final retry of a payment fails, resulting in a failed invoice.

unsuccessfully_charged_invoice_provider.description: Payment error (retry). Sent when payment fails, resulting in an unpaid invoice and a retry.

weekly_report.description: Weekly report. Contains information about your API(s) performance in the last 7 days.

get.description: Returns APIcast Policy Registry
Returns your account.

put.description: Updates email addresses used to deliver email notifications to customers.

get.description: Returns a list of all service plans for all services. Note that service plans are scoped by service.
Returns the list of features enabled on a service plan.

post.description: Enables an existing feature on a service plan.

delete.description: Disables a feature on a service plan.

get.description: Returns the list of all services.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

post.description: Creates a new service.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See ServiceCreateRequest schema for the request body definition.

get.description: Returns the service by id.

put.description: Update the service.

requestBody.description: Custom fields can be specified in the request by adding `&custom-field=value` to the body parameters. See ServiceUpdateRequest schema for the request body definition.

delete.description: Delete the service. Deleting a service removes all applications and service subscriptions.

get.description: Returns a list of all service plans for a service.

post.description: Creates a new service plan in a service.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Service subscriptions require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

state_event.description: State event of the service plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

get.description: Returns the list of metrics of a service.

post.description: Creates a metric on a service.

system_name.description: System Name of the metric. This is the name used to report API requests with the Service Management API. If blank a system_name will be generated for you from the friendly_name parameter

get.description: Returns the metric of a service.

put.description: Updates the metric of a service.

delete.description: Deletes the metric of a service. When you delete a metric or a method, it will also remove all the associated limits across application plans.

get.description: List the methods of a metric that belongs to a service. Methods are metrics that are children of a parent metric.

post.description: Creates a method under a metric that belongs to a service.

system_name.description: System Name of the method. This is the name used to report API requests with the Service Management API. If blank, a system_name will be generated for you from the friendly_name parameter

get.description: Returns the method of a metric that belongs to a service.

put.description: Updates a method of a metric that belongs to a service.

delete.description: Deletes the method of a metric that belongs to a service.

get.description: Returns the Proxy Configs of the provider

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

get.description: Returns the Proxy of a Service.

patch.description: Changes the Proxy settings. This will create a new APIcast configuration version for the Staging environment with the updated settings.

endpoint.description: Public Base URL for production environment.

api_backend.description: Private Base URL. Caution! Do not use it if the account has API as a Product enabled. It may cause API backend usages to be removed from the Product.

credentials_location.description: Credentials Location. Either headers, query or authorization for the Basic Authorization.

auth_app_key.description: Parameter/Header where App Key is expected.

auth_app_id.description: Parameter/Header where App ID is expected.

auth_user_key.description: Parameter/Header where User Key is expected.

error_no_match.description: Error message when no mapping rule is matched.

error_status_no_match.description: Content-Type header when no mapping rule is matched.

error_status_limits_exceeded.description: Status code when usage limit exceeded.

error_headers_limits_exceeded.description: Content-Type header when usage limit exceeded.

error_limits_exceeded.description: Error message on usage limit exceeded.

jwt_claim_with_client_id_type.description: JWT Claim With ClientId Type. Either `plain` or `liquid`

post.description: Promotes the APIcast configuration to the Staging Environment (Production Environment in case of Service Mesh).

get.description: Returns the Mapping Rules of a Proxy.

post.description: Creates a Proxy Mapping Rule. The proxy object needs to be updated after a mapping rule is added to apply the change to the APIcast configuration. If adding multiple mapping rules then only one call to the Proxy Update endpoint is necessary after all mapping rules have been created.

delta.description: Increase the metric by this delta.

last.description: Last matched Mapping Rule to process

get.description: Returns the Mapping Rule.

delete.description: Deletes a Proxy Mapping Rule. The proxy object needs to be updated after a mapping rule is deleted to apply the change to the APIcast configuration. If deleting multiple mapping rules then only one call to the Proxy Update endpoint is necessary after all desired mapping rules have been deleted.

patch.description: Updates a Proxy Mapping Rule. The proxy object needs to be updated after a mapping rule is updated to apply the change to the APIcast configuration. If updating multiple mapping rules then only one call to the Proxy Update endpoint is necessary after all mapping rules have been updated.

delta.description: Increase the metric by this delta.

last.description: Last matched Mapping Rule to process

get.description: Get the Proxy OIDC configuration.
Returns the Proxy Configs of a Service
Returns the latest Proxy Config.
Returns a Proxy Config.

post.description: Promotes a Proxy Config from one environment to another environment.

to.description: The name of the destination environment

get.description: Returns a Proxy Policies Chain.

put.description: Updates a Proxy Policies Chain.

get.description: Returns a service plan by ID.

put.description: Updates a service plan by ID.

approval_required.description: Set the 'Service subscriptions require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

state_event.description: State event of the service plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

delete.description: Deletes a service plan by ID.

put.description: Sets the service plan as default. The default service plan is used when no explicit service plan is used.

post.description: Creates a feature on a service. Features are usually associated to a particular type of plan; you can associate the plan on the scope parameter. Note that account plans are not scoped by service.

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

get.description: Returns a feature of a service.

put.description: Updates a feature of a service.

delete.description: Deletes a feature of a service.

get.description: Returns the general settings of an account.

put.description: Updates general settings.

useraccountarea_enabled.description: Allow the user to edit their submitted details, change passwords, etc

signups_enabled.description: Developers are allowed sign up themselves.

account_approval_required.description: Approval is required by you before developer accounts are activated.

public_search.description: Enables public search on Developer Portal

enforce_sso.description:
Enforce SSO authentication on the admin portal and disable password-based authentication for all users of this account by setting `enforce_sso` to `true`. Enforcing SSO is only allowed when there is at least one published SSO integration for the admin portal.
To enable password-based authentication, set `enforce_sso` to `false`

put.description: Updates webhooks.

url.description: URL that will be notified about all the events

provider_actions.description: Dashboard actions fire webhooks. If false, only user actions in the portal trigger events.

get.description: Lists of webhooks that could not be delivered to your end-point after 5 trials. A webhook is considered delivered if your end-point responds with a 200, otherwise it retries 5 times at 60 second intervals.

delete.description: Deletes failed delivery records. It is advisable to delete the records past the time of the last webhook failure that was received instead of deleting them all. Between the GET and the DELETE other webhooks failures may have arrived.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Only failed webhook deliveries whose time is less than or equal to the passed time are destroyed (if used).

name.description: Name of the application to be created.

description.description: Description of the application to be created.

user_key.description:
User Key (API Key) of the application to be created.

Allowed characters: A-Z a-z 0-9 - _ . or Base64 format without forward slash (/), no spaces and up to 256 characters.

application_id.description:
App ID or Client ID (for OAuth and OpenID Connect authentication modes) of the application to be created.

Allowed characters: A-Z a-z 0-9 ! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / : ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ ` { | } ~ , no spaces and between 5 and 255 characters.

application_key.description:
App Key or Client Secret (for OAuth and OpenID Connect authentication modes) of the application to be created.

Allowed characters: A-Z a-z 0-9 ! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / : ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ ` { | } ~ , no spaces and between 5 and 255 characters.

redirect_url.description: Redirect URL for the OAuth request.

first_traffic_at.description: Timestamp of the first call made by the application.

first_daily_traffic_at.description: Timestamp of the first call on the last day when traffic was registered for the application ('Traffic On').

redirect_url.description: Redirect URL for the OAuth request.

first_traffic_at.description: Timestamp of the first call made by the application.

first_daily_traffic_at.description: Timestamp of the first call on the last day when traffic was registered for the application ('Traffic On').

user_key.description: User Key (API Key) of the application to be updated.

name.description: Name of the service to be created.

description.description: Description of the service to be created.

deployment_option.description: Deployment option for the gateway: 'hosted' for APIcast hosted, 'self_managed' for APIcast Self-managed, 'service_mesh_istio' for Istio service mesh option

backend_version.description: Authentication mode: '1' for API key, '2' for App Id / App Key, 'oidc' for OpenID Connect

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

name.description: Name of the service to be created.

description.description: Description of the service to be created.

deployment_option.description: Deployment option for the gateway: 'hosted' for APIcast hosted, 'self_managed' for APIcast Self-managed, 'service_mesh_istio' for Istio service mesh option

backend_version.description: Authentication mode: '1' for API key, '2' for App Id / App Key, 'oidc' for OpenID Connect

system_name.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

org_name.description: Organization Name of the developer account.

username.description: Username of the admin user (on the new developer account).

account_plan_id.description: ID of the account plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

service_plan_id.description: ID of the service plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

application_plan_id.description: ID of the application plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).
